pros: Get to do what you love and have a great impact
cons: Tend to take on a lot of extra work. Although you do know what you are getting into a head of time - you don't take this job for the money - you take it because you do what you love.

review_title: A great place to grow as an employee and as a person
pros: WLC is a great place to work. The community is supportive. Faculty work hard because they rally around a common purpose--serving their students. It's an excellent place to grow professionally and personally.
cons: Most are not at WLC for the money, so if you are looking to make the big bucks, WLC is likely not for you.

job_title: Adjunct Professor of Art History in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Small class sizes and caring staff
cons: Low pay for adjuncts but worth it

pros: There are some truly awesome people who strongly support the mission of WLC.  Work/life balance is excellent and there are a lot of side benefits (on campus fitness center and weight training facility, free heated indoor parking, free admission to all campus events).  The college has grown quite a bit in the past five years so some opportunities for advancement have been created.  Overall it is a good place to work but there are so many easy ways it could be made better and that is frustrating.  I'd still recommend it to the right person but if you are looking to come in and make innovative changes to achieve greatness forget it.
cons: No clear direction regarding growth strategy.  The cabinet always says it wants more students but then fails to put strategies in place that will offer growth and innovative efforts are constantly getting hijacked because of academic policy that was, in some cases, created 25 years ago when WLC was a 2 year school.

pros: Christian environment, more than average flexibility in schedule, much freedom to do you own thing.
cons: Little support from administration and board in terms of resources and salaries. Has become very top heavy in the last five years. Career progression is often political.

pros: A committed, caring group of Christians who want to build an institution of excellence!
cons: Not everyone in the team is pulling in the same direction.

job_title: Head Of Human Resources in Waukesha, WI
pros: Engaged and mission driven workforce.  Outstanding product with best value proposition and bang for the buck of all private colleges in WI - per Forbes.
cons: Experience carving niche out of competitive marketplaces.

job_title: Assistant Program Coordinator & Coach in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great kids to work with, great atmosphere, and perfect central location... I just love what I do!
cons: Wish coaching was doable as a full time career!
